apps.chess

Class ChessPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • apps.chess.ChessPlayer

  • public class ChessPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
    Class representing a chess player Contains name, ELO, indexes to games played by the player within the GamesMetaDataCollection Contains repertoire data according to ECO

    • Field Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addGameBlack(GameMetaDataInstance g, int gameIndex)
      Adds a game played by the player as black to its data, therefore causing a change of repertoire as well

      Adds a game played by the player as white to its data, therefore causing a change of repertoire as well

      • addGameWhite

        public void addGameWhite(GameMetaDataInstance g,
                int gameIndex)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Adds a game played by the player as white to its data, therefore causing a change of repertoire as well
        Parameters:
        g - The chess game meta data
        gameIndex - index within the collection stored in the player
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • addGameBlack

        public void addGameBlack(GameMetaDataInstance g,
                int gameIndex)
        Adds a game played by the player as black to its data, therefore causing a change of repertoire as well
        Parameters:
        g - The chess game meta data
        gameIndex - index within the collection stored in the player
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • toExtendedString

        public java.lang.String toExtendedString()
        Method used to persist the player collection (and hence, player) data to a file It gives a representation of a player in one String
        Returns:
        String representing the player

      • fromExtendedString

        public static ChessPlayer fromExtendedString(java.lang.String s,
                             GamesMetaDataCollection dc)
                                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Parameters:
        s - String from which to load the player data
        dc - collection from which the game data comes from - more specifically, to which the indexes that are to be loaded refer
        Returns:
        Chess player instance loaded from the String
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
